fields.summary: Cluster controller can take over 60 seconds to respond to address unassign

comments.body:
The unassign exchange is tcp.stream 24, starting at #242 16.98 seconds in. 

For this capture the timeout on the cloud controller was increased to 120 seconds.

Tried reproducing a few times, using the bash one-liner included, but was unable to see the delay. Based on cc.log and tcpdump analysis, my CC was responding with UnassignAddress promptly. So, I am wondering under what situation the delay arises. [~sjones], is there an installation that consistently shows this behavior?
I was having trouble reproducing and changed the sleep to 0.01 which seems to reproduce each time.

Actually, I don't think this is quite the same, the cluster controller log shows the following and the unassign request fails (was successful previously):

{code}
2013-05-14 11:49:43 ERROR 000009331 ncTerminateInstanceStub  | operation on 192.168.51.101 could not be invoked (check NC host, port, and credentials): Response timed out
2013-05-14 11:49:43 ERROR 000009376 ncAssignAddressStub      | operation on 192.168.51.101 could not be invoked (check NC host, port, and credentials): Response timed out
2013-05-14 11:49:43 ERROR 000005423 doUnassignAddress        | could not sync IP with NC
2013-05-14 11:49:43 DEBUG 000005423 pubIpSet                 | pubIpSet(): set: 192.168.40.126/0.0.0.0
2013-05-14 11:49:43 ERROR 000005423 UnassignAddressMarshal   | doUnassignAddress() failed
{code}

Seeing the following in the cluster / node controller logs when the above occurs:

cc.log:
{code}
2013-05-14 12:58:25 ERROR 000012061 ncTerminateInstanceStub  | operation on 192.168.51.83 could not be invoked (check NC host, port, and credentials): Response timed out
2013-05-14 12:58:25 ERROR 000012106 ncAssignAddressStub      | operation on 192.168.51.83 could not be invoked (check NC host, port, and credentials): Response timed out
{code}

nc.log:
{code}
2013-05-14 12:57:25  INFO 000005607 doTerminateInstance      | [i-09B44358] termination requested
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 sensor_refresh_resources | polled statistics for 1 instance(s)
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 find_or_alloc_sm         | allocated new sensor metric i-09B44358:CPUUtilization
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 find_or_alloc_sc         | allocated new sensor counter CPUUtilization:summation
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 find_or_alloc_sd         | allocated new sensor dimension summation:default
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 sensor_merge_records     | completed: merged 1 values, ret=0
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 find_or_alloc_sm         | allocated new sensor metric i-09B44358:NetworkIn
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 find_or_alloc_sc         | allocated new sensor counter NetworkIn:summation
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 find_or_alloc_sd         | allocated new sensor dimension summation:total
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 sensor_merge_records     | completed: merged 1 values, ret=0
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 find_or_alloc_sm         | allocated new sensor metric i-09B44358:NetworkOut
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 find_or_alloc_sc         | allocated new sensor counter NetworkOut:summation
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 find_or_alloc_sd         | allocated new sensor dimension summation:total
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 sensor_merge_records     | completed: merged 1 values, ret=0
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 sensor_merge_records     | completed: merged 1 values, ret=0
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 sensor_merge_records     | completed: merged 1 values, ret=0
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 sensor_merge_records     | completed: merged 1 values, ret=0
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 sensor_merge_records     | completed: merged 1 values, ret=0
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 sensor_merge_records     | completed: merged 1 values, ret=0
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 sensor_merge_records     | completed: merged 1 values, ret=0
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 sensor_merge_records     | completed: merged 1 values, ret=0
2013-05-14 12:57:25 DEBUG 000005607 shutdown_then_destroy_do | shutting down instance
2013-05-14 12:58:25 DEBUG 000005607 shutdown_then_destroy_do | destroying instance
2013-05-14 12:58:26  INFO 000005607 find_and_terminate_insta | [i-09B44358] instance terminated
2013-05-14 12:58:26 DEBUG 000005607 change_state             | [i-09B44358] state change for instance: Running -> 
{code}
Capture of the cluster controller to node controller interaction, request takes 60 seconds at tcp.stream eq 11 #165 14.11 seconds in.

Ah! This finally rings a bell! The 1-minute delay is due to the timeout on NC that gives the guest OS that long to shut down itself cleanly. That is adjustable, naturally (SHUTDOWN_GRACE_PERIOD_SEC in node/handlers_default.c). We can shorten the period on the NC or lengthen the timeout on the CLC. Perhaps we should have a quick email thread on that?
Sounds good, looks like the cluster controller timeout is also 60, so may need adjustment.
I made shutdown code asynchronous, so TerminateInstance request should not block for very long now. Thus, none of the {{Response timed out}} errors seen by [~sjones] should occur any more.

That was not the whole story, as it turns out. I forgot one more lock that was blocking some calls concurrent to termination. This should be resolved now, as of 5e20db33be8b166572da9ece1dadec8eecd29150 of 'eucalyptus'.
